components.name: Customer Support Center
components.description: This includes services related to reaching support via phone, email, and chat.

incident_updates.body: All services are recovered expect for Accounts API; specifically, accounts created via Accounts API since approximately 2:10AM PT on 7 December 2023 are unavailable in IE1 region. Teams are working to restore normal functionality. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information is available.

We are continuing to see recovery across multiple Twilio products. We will continue monitoring to ensure full service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are continuing to see recovery across multiple Twilio products. We will continue monitoring to ensure full service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are continuing to see recovery across multiple Twilio products. We will continue monitoring to ensure full service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are continuing to see recovery across multiple Twilio products. We will continue monitoring to ensure full service stability. We will provide another update in 30 mins or as soon as more information becomes available.

Note: We are making a correction about the previous post; neither SMS nor Programmable Video > Group Rooms were impacted by this incident

We are starting to see recovery across several products. Currently, our engineering teams are reviewing  their services to ensure they are operating normally and remain stable. We will provide another update in 30 mins or as soon as more information becomes available.

Customers will be seeing an elevated error rate and latency for Conversations and Programmable Chat API-s and SDK-s in the IE1 region. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will provide another update in 30mins or as soon as more information becomes available.

Customers will be seeing an elevated error rate and latency for Conversations and Programmable Chat API-s and SDK-s in the IE1 region. We will update as soon as we have more information in the next 30 mins

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Accounts API for Ireland region. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Receipts Delay to Movistar Network in Ecuador

incident_updates.body: We are observing recovery in delivery report delays when sending to Movistar Network in Ecuador. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing delays in receiving message delivery reports when sending to Movistar Network in Ecuador. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with SMS delivery receipts delay to Movistar network in Ecuador. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: LTE-M Connectivity on Telefonica O2 in the United Kingdom Blocked

incident_updates.body:
We are aware of devices being unable to connect to the LTE-M network on O2 in the United Kingdom. O2 has, without notice, blocked all inbound LTE-M traffic from SIMs roaming on their network. This is not just impacting our products, but also products from other providers roaming onto O2s network. We are engaged with our multiple tier-1 carrier partners who have also been impacted and are working toward a resolution of this matter.
O2 is the only LTE-M network in the UK to which Super SIM can connect. Devices able to use 2G, which many LTE-M modems also support, should have been able to maintain their connectivity by connecting to various 2G networks offered in the UK. If you are planning to release LTE-M enabled devices into the UK, please ensure they also support 2G and that its enabled for fallback on your devices. 
There is currently no timeline for when LTE-M connectivity on O2 will be restored for SIMs roaming onto their network. We do not expect this matter to be resolved in a matter of days. We intend to keep this incident posted until Monday, December 11th, after which it will be closed. We will provide updates if we get any new details. If you would like to receive updates about this matter after this status is closed, please open a support ticket with KOREs customer support team referencing this incident. Learn more about the support transition for IoT products to KORE and how to open a ticket with KORE here: https://www.twilio.com/docs/iot/kore-acquisition/iot-customer-support-migration-to-kore
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with SuperSIM. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

The maintenance window is planned to take up to 3 hours. During the maintenance window, Flex Insights Historical Reporting access will be unavailable.

scheduled_maintenances.name: Twilio's Messaging Services Feature is Undergoing a Routine Maintenance

incident_updates.body:
Were conducting a planned maintenance in all countries between 11:00 PM and 12:00 AM Pacific Time on 12/14/2023. During the maintenance window, customers will see high latency and possible 5xx errors while trying to add/remove senders from a Messaging Service.

There will be no impact on any of the messages being sent via a messaging service.

incident_updates.body:
Our carrier partner Deutsche Telekom is conducting a planned maintenance from 18 December 2023 at 00:00 PST until 18 December 2023 at 08:00 PST. During the maintenance window, there could be intermittent API request failures for Deutsche Telekom customers.

Impacted Products: Verify Silent Network Auth, Lookup SIM Swap, Lookup Identity Match and Legacy Identity MatchAndAttributes.

scheduled_maintenances.name: Russia SMS Carrier Maintenance - Tele2

incident_updates.body: Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.
Maintenance will begin as scheduled in 60 minutes.

The Tele2 network in Russia is conducting a series of planned maintenances from 04 December 2023 at 12:00 PST until 27 December 2023 at 16:00 PST. During the maintenance window, there could be intermittent delays delivering SMS to Tele2 Russia handsets.

Note, the maintenance will be carried out on each of the following dates and times:

04 December 2023 at 12:00 PDT until 04 December 2023 at 16:00 PDT
06 December 2023 at 12:00 PDT until 06 December 2023 at 16:00 PDT
11 December 2023 at 12:00 PDT until 11 December 2023 at 16:00 PDT
